abstract: Yale lecturer Erika Christakis, who came under attack for challenging students to stand up for their right to decide what Halloween costumes to wear on campus, voluntarily resigns from her position; challenge followed directive from Yale's Intercultural Affairs Committee suggesting some costumes could be culturally inappropriate or insensitive.
lead_paragraph: Erika Christakis, who had suggested there could be negative consequences to the university’s directive to be sensitive when choosing Halloween costumes, resigned from her position voluntarily, the school said.
